comments:
20070103

Here is how I got the exception
- debug with 6.0 and stop at a breakpoint
- in the variables view, select a instance and call 'All Instances...'
- the quick view pops up
- Expand the node, while it populates, click outside the view

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.model.TreeModelContentProvider.getPresentationContext(TreeModelContentProvider.java:180)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.model.ViewerUpdateMonitor.getPresentationContext(ViewerUpdateMonitor.java:147)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.elements.ElementContentProvider.updateHasChildren(ElementContentProvider.java:215)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.elements.ElementContentProvider$3.run(ElementContentProvider.java:194)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2007-03-01 11:47:54.743
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Label Job".
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Widget is disposed
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3478)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3401)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3372)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:432)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.getDisplay(Widget.java:542)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.model.TreeModelLabelProvider.getDisplay(TreeModelLabelProvider.java:115)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.model.TreeModelLabelProvider.complete(TreeModelLabelProvider.java:236)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.model.LabelUpdate.done(LabelUpdate.java:150)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.elements.ElementLabelProvider$LabelUpdater.run(ElementLabelProvider.java:141)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.elements.ElementLabelProvider$LabelJob.run(ElementLabelProvider.java:60)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
Looks like the "label update" job was being run after a pop-up was closed. We should only create/schedule the label update job if the viewer has not yet been diposed.

The NPE is a duplicate of the first NPE in bug 176957.  Darin's fix for 176957 eliminates the NPE.

I could not reproduce the SWTException (disposed).  The fix for 176957 should also fix the SWTException as the label update job will be cancelled.  

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 176957 ***
Reopening to patch possible race condition

Created an attachment (id=60612)
Patch

Patch makes changes to TreeModelLabelProvider.  When the dispose() method is called all known running label update jobs are now cancelled.  Furthermore, when complete is called, if the job has been cancelled, the UIJob is not scheduled, instead, updateComplete is called immediately.
